definition: to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Are we the mediators that pull warring sides together?
sentences.chinese: 我們是將交戰雙方拉近的調停者嗎？

sentences.english: Those who in quarrels interpose must often wipe a bloody nose.
sentences.chinese: 那些吵架的調停者必須時常抹鼻血。

sentences.english: Most of all, the prime minister can thank his long-serving team of advisers and fixers .
sentences.chinese: 最重要的是首相要感謝顧問團隊及調停者的不懈努力。

sentences.english: He is the only divine-human Mediator.
sentences.chinese: 他是唯一的神和人之間的調停者。

sentences.english: The mediator attempted to get both sides to modify their positions.
sentences.chinese: 這個調停者試圖讓雙方對各自的立場都做一下變動。
